cence. Those with milder forms of the disorder usually live into adulthood, although their life expectancy may be reduced. Heart disease and airway obstruction are major causes of death in people with MPS VI.",GHR,mucopolysaccharidosis type VI
How many people are affected by mucopolysaccharidosis type VI ?,"The exact incidence of MPS VI is unknown, although it is estimated to occur in 1 in 250,000 to 600,000 newborns.",GHR,mucopolysaccharidosis type VI
